de.fraunhofer.iem.secucheck.InternalFluentTQL.catalog.CommandInjection.CWE77

Class CommandInjection

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.servlet.GenericServlet
      • javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
        • de.fraunhofer.iem.secucheck.InternalFluentTQL.catalog.CommandInjection.CWE77.CommandInjection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, javax.servlet.Servlet, javax.servlet.ServletConfig

    public class CommandInjection
extends javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
    This class contains the example for command injection. This example has been taken from the OWASP Benchmark: BenchmarkTest00051.
    See Also:
    BenchmarkTest00051, Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CommandInjection()

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void doGetWithoutSanitizer(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
      This method runs the simple echo command with the message given by the user.
      void doGetWithSanitizer(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
      This method runs the simple echo command with the message given by the user.
      java.lang.String sanitizeForCommand(java.lang.String message)
      This method uses OWASP ESAPI to sanitize the user input for the OS to avoid command injection.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CommandInjection

        public CommandInjection()

    • Method Detail

      • doGetWithoutSanitizer

        public void doGetWithoutSanitizer(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                  javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
        This method runs the simple echo command with the message given by the user. This method does not use any sanitizer, therefore, this method contains command injection attack.
        Parameters:
        request - HttpServlet request from the user.
        response - HttpServlet response to the user.

      • doGetWithSanitizer

        public void doGetWithSanitizer(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                               javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        This method runs the simple echo command with the message given by the user. This method uses sanitizer, therefore, this method avoids command injection attack.
        Parameters:
        request - HttpServlet request from the user.
        response - HttpServlet response to the user.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If fails to load ESAPI properties file.

      • sanitizeForCommand

        public java.lang.String sanitizeForCommand(java.lang.String message)
                                    throws java.io.IOException
        This method uses OWASP ESAPI to sanitize the user input for the OS to avoid command injection.
        Parameters:
        message - Message.
        Returns:
        sanitized message.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If fails to load ESAPI properties file.
        See Also:
        encodeForOS
